p: Other studies investigated the functional interactions between microbes and host associated with type 1 diabetes pathogenesis development [ 13, 14]. Using a metaproteomics approach, Gavin and colleagues [ 13] identified clear signatures for new-onset type 1 diabetes in stool that can be useful in the development of therapies and diagnosis. Similarly, Tanca and colleagues [ 14] found that Clostridial butyrate biosynthesis enzymes were significantly reduced in diabetic mice as compared to nondiabetic mice [ 11], adding to the evidence that the intestinal microbiota is involved in the pathogenesis of type 1 diabetes and that reduction of butyrate synthesis may play a role.
